individualProjects.title: Cross-Stitch Catalogue
individualProjects.description: Web application built with ReactJS designed to allow users to organize their needlecraft projects and threads. Application uses Firebase as database. When writing API calls Postman was utilized to test Endpoints. Built using Bootstrap and SCSS styling libraries Application allows users to save crosstitch patterns and add the required threads to the pattern details. Users can indicate if the thread is owned, and if it is not the thread will be added to a shopping list view. This project was build in 4 weeks as a solo capstone project to showcase knowledge in front-end development.

individualProjects.title: React Hoarder
individualProjects.description: React Hoarder is a web app designed for the user to store their favorite items. Similar to a shopping wishlist, or Pinterest. It utilizes the React framework to build the app along with css styling and Firebase to store JSON data. Created to exercise knowledge in React routing and proptypes - this app met MVP by being able to create, read, update, and delete items. As well as, having a single view to read more details about a selected item, and using google authentication. The app also met team stretch goals to assign a 'favorite' attribute to an items and being able to view favorites in a seperate view. This app was completed over the course of 7 days by a 4-person group on a part-time basis.

individualProjects.title: Hip Hop, Pizza, and Wangs
individualProjects.description: Web application build with JS, HTML, and CSS allows users to create unique orders for a restaurant.  Application built using 'CRUD' capabilities in mind. Users can create, read, update, and delete orders. As well as view more details related to each order. Project was planned using Kanban boards and individual issue ticket assignment. Acted as team lead on project to guide planning, ticket assignment, and milestone completion.

individualProjects.title: GitSub
individualProjects.description: Web page built using vanilla Javascript, HTML, and CSS. First group development project. Built to immulate GitHub. Users can view About Me, Repositories, Projects, and Packages pages. Pages contain features to search, sort, and pin the different elements. The project was created by a 4 person student group over the course of 10 days.
